description: Pyoderma Gangrenosum is a rare, inflammatory skin condition characterized by painful ulcers that typically begin as small bumps or blisters. These ulcers can rapidly grow in size and depth, often with a purplish or blue edge. The exact cause of Pyoderma Gangrenosum is unknown, but it is believed to be related to an abnormal immune response. It is not contagious.
possible causes: Certain medications or underlying health conditions
symptoms: Skin lesions that rapidly grow in size
